intro: Phyllanthus pentaphyllus subsp. polycladus, commonly known as the Indian false sandalwood, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, spherical fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
